slides.title: AI Training

content.headline: Make AI Sound Like You
content.subhead: Train your AI assistant in 20 minutes

slides.narration: Generic AI sounds like... generic AI. But trained AI sounds like your business—your voice, your expertise, your way of helping customers. Let's train yours to be unmistakably you.

slides.title: What You'll Train
slides.narration: We'll train your AI on business knowledge—what you do and how you do it. Voice and tone—how you talk to customers. Common scenarios—the situations that come up repeatedly. And boundaries—when AI should escalate to a human.

slides.title: Step 1: Business Knowledge
slides.narration: Start with business knowledge. Upload service descriptions and pricing. Add your FAQs—you've already done that work. Include policies on returns, cancellations, guarantees. Hours, location, contact info. And what makes you different from competitors. This becomes AI's knowledge base.

slides.title: Step 2: Voice and Tone
slides.narration: Define your voice and tone. Are you formal or casual? Do you use emojis? Technical jargon or plain language? Warm and personal or efficient and direct? The best way: provide example responses you've actually written. Real emails, real messages. AI learns from your examples.

slides.title: Step 3: Common Scenarios

content.format: For each: Example question → Ideal response

slides.narration: Train on common scenarios. Pricing questions. Scheduling requests. Service inquiries. Complaints. Special requests. For each scenario, provide an example question and your ideal response. The more examples, the better AI handles variations.

slides.title: Step 4: Set Boundaries

boundaries: What AI can and can't promise

slides.narration: Set clear boundaries. Topics AI shouldn't discuss—maybe specific pricing negotiations or competitor comparisons. When to escalate to a human—set clear triggers. What AI can promise versus what needs human approval. How to handle sensitive situations. Escalate when customer asks for manager, mentions legal issues, expresses strong frustration, or has complex custom requests.

slides.title: Pro Tips

tips: Review AI conversations weekly at first
Update training when you notice gaps
Test by asking tricky questions yourself

slides.narration: AI training pro tips. Review AI conversations weekly at first—you'll spot gaps quickly. Update training when you notice AI missing something. Test by asking tricky questions yourself before customers do. Use the feedback loop—mark responses as good or bad so AI keeps learning.

slides.title: Train Your AI
slides.narration: Ready to make AI sound like you? Start training now—twenty minutes of setup saves hours of generic responses. Or see training examples from businesses like yours first. Your AI should be unmistakably yours.
